verb.description: (of a person or group) act in accordance with a wish or command.
examples: we are unable to comply with your request

origin: Late 16th century: from Italian complire, Catalan complir, Spanish cumplir, from Latin complere fill up, fulfill (see complete). The original sense was fulfill, accomplish, later fulfill the requirements of courtesy, hence to be agreeable, to oblige or obey. Compare with compliment.
